support_summary: ATXN3 interacts with monoubiquitinated STUB1/CHIP to degrade misfolded chaperone substrates, restricting the length of the ubiquitin chain on these substrates.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 collaborates with the E3 ubiquitin ligase STUB1 (CHIP) in the degradation of misfolded substrates targeted by chaperones.
functions.effect_description: Monoubiquitination of STUB1/CHIP by the E2 enzyme Ube2w facilitates the recruitment of ATXN3. ATXN3 then acts to trim or restrict the length of ubiquitin chains being added to the substrate, effectively editing the signal for degradation. After substrate ubiquitination, ATXN3 deubiquitinates STUB1/CHIP.
biological_consequence: Misfolded protein recognized by chaperones → STUB1/CHIP is recruited and monoubiquitinated → ATXN3 is recruited → ATXN3 edits ubiquitin chain length on substrate → Regulated degradation of substrate by proteasome
specific_effects: ATXN3's interaction with STUB1/CHIP is stabilized by the ubiquitination of STUB1/CHIP.
ATXN3 restricts the length of ubiquitin chains on STUB1/CHIP substrates, rather than completely removing them.
This coordinated action represents a key regulatory point in ubiquitin-dependent protein quality control.

evidence.paper_title: Ube2w and ataxin-3 coordinately regulate the ubiquitin ligase CHIP
The deubiquitinase function of ataxin-3 and its role in the pathogenesis of Machado-Joseph disease and other diseases

mechanism: ATXN3 collaborates with the E3 ubiquitin ligase STUB1 (CHIP) in the degradation of misfolded substrates targeted by chaperones.
effect: Monoubiquitination of STUB1/CHIP by the E2 enzyme Ube2w facilitates the recruitment of ATXN3. ATXN3 then acts to trim or restrict the length of ubiquitin chains being added to the substrate, effectively editing the signal for degradation. After substrate ubiquitination, ATXN3 deubiquitinates STUB1/CHIP.
summary: ATXN3 activates STUB1 to modulate protein quality control, ultimately affecting regulated degradation of substrate by proteasome.

evidence.paper_title: Ube2w and ataxin-3 coordinately regulate the ubiquitin ligase CHIP
The deubiquitinase function of ataxin-3 and its role in the pathogenesis of Machado-Joseph disease and other diseases
